column4: Does anyone have any idea what I need to do to get my internet working? (or more specifically, what driver I need to get)
Wired.
I have an Atheros AR8161/8165 Ethernet Adapter
can you ping 8.8.8.8 ?
can you ping your routers internal P address?
what is the output of:  lsb_release -sc
ctrl+shift+c to copy and ctrl+shift+v to paste, or use mouse
that tells us nothing
if you can run:  sudo lshw -C network   in Ubuntu, copy the file to the NTFS (as windows is garbage and cannot read Ext4), you can then pastebin it
please pastebin the file :)
seems its not in precise yet but will be in Quantal (Ubuntu 12.10 which is pre-release now), https://bugs.launchpad.net/ubuntu/+source/linux/+bug/927782
yes but its officially not stable but could work, !wfm
you could always try the live CD, see if it works there :)
Would that also make my cooling fan work properly?
the newer kernel may help. Do you use a switchable video chip by any chance?
doesn't say much, toshiba make a tonne of differnet systems
if you look in device manager, do you see 2 different display chips?
ok then it's just a single gpu, which is good :)
you can reinstate grub from the liveCD: http://www.omgubuntu.co.uk/2011/09/live-usb-sticking-grub-2-video
if you only have windows installed you will need to reinstate the windows bootloader, ##windows will help there
Thanks, I'll go there.
